ygData.messageBody:
Maybe someone could explain this too me. I'm not sure why a human SK would have any tougher of a time than say a human paladin as their stats are almost identical. I'm under the impression that DE's and Humans have a tougher time in melee than the big races (because of inherent STR/STA and Slam), but not to the point of not making them a viable class. I also tend to think exp penalties even this out a lot. The penalty on the TSK is HUGE (to the point where I've about given up on this character). I'm in the 20's now and it takes me WEEKS of real time to level (partly due to the constant KoS problems which causes at least 4 deaths per level). That's why I'm moving on the experiment with other character classes and races. If it takes me 3 weeks now to level in the 20's, what will it be like at 40? I'm convinced if I was playing a human I would at least be 25th by now, if not higher.

Scragg Wraithbone (22nd level TSK)
semi-retired

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

> One problem that SKs face -- and one of the reasons that they are so
difficult to play -- is that they were tuned on the assumption
> that you would be playing an Ogre or Troll. As such, human SKs are quite
possibly the second most difficult class/race combination
> in the game to play (after Erudite Paladin).

The human SKs? At least they don't have the staggering exp penalty that dark
elves do. As for being the most difficult (or second-most) class combo, why
is it that there are 3 level 50 human SKs on Fennin Ro and only 1 level 50
dark elf SK?
